quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Group and Members
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, knock, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 1970s Knock Three Times song by Tony Orlando and Dawn, how many times means the answer is no?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Twice

questions.question: The members of this group included Suggs, Woody Woodgate, Chas Smash, Lee Thompson and Mike Barson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madness

questions.question: How many holes are shot into the freezer in Jimmy Buffetts Boat Drinks song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: Following an advertisement in a music paper called Melody Maker, Vince Clarke finally settled with Andy Bell as vocalist for this group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erasure

questions.question: Ludwig van Beethovens last complete symphony was Symphony No. 5.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In a Mad World this group could have been made up of Curt Smith and Roland Orzabal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tears for Fears

questions.question: Which band had Philip Oakey, Susan Sully, Joanne Catherall and Ian Burden as members?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Human League

questions.question: Which group was made up from Jon Moss, Roy Hay, Mikey Craig and an eccentric frontman named George ODowd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Culture Club

questions.question: Which of the following songs was not performed by Jay and The Americans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Copacabana (At the Copa)

questions.question: This group, named after a character in a science fiction movie, included members Simon Le Bon, Nick Rhodes, Andy Taylor, Roger Taylor and John Taylor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duran Duran

questions.question: Which of these was a song by The Detergents?

options.text: Cant Get Enough of Your Love

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leader of the Laundromat

questions.question: Dolly Parton sang the title song 9 to 5 for the 1980 movie Nine to Five. Who was the sexist, egotistical, lying, hypocritical bigot boss in this movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin M Hart Jr

questions.question: This group was formed in 1983 and split in 1986. Amongst its members were Paul Heaton, Stan Cullimore, NormanCook and Dave Hemingway.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Housemartins

questions.question: Named after a magazine, this group has included Dave Gahan, Martin Gore, Vince Clarke, Andrew Fletcher and Alan Wilder amongst its members.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Depeche Mode

questions.question: This group comprising of Holly Johnson, Paul Rutherford, Mark OToole, Peter Gill and Brian Nash was formed in Liverpool in the mid 80s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frankie Goes to Hollywood

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, definition, parlance. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Dim All the Lights was a hit song for this diva in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donna Summer

questions.question: This singer had a big hit song in 1968 with a re-make of The Doors song Light My Fire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jose Feliciano

questions.question: Where is the band U2 from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dublin, Ireland

questions.question: This funk band had a big hit song in the 1970s called Flash Light.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parliament

questions.question: Heartlight was a hit song for this singer in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Diamond

questions.question: Turn Off the Lights was a hit song for this RB singer in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teddy Pendergrass

questions.question: In guitar parlance, what do the terms H.O and P.O mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hammer on and pull off..

questions.question: Slowhand is the nickname of which guitar legend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric Clapton

questions.question: What is the location of the song featured in the audio clip?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alabama

questions.question: What is the formal name for a guitar pick?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plectrum

questions.question: What is the key with no flats and no sharps?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: C

questions.question: Choose the best definition of Arpeggio from the following list?

options.text: Pattern of individually played chord notes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pattern of individually played chord notes

questions.question: Waltz is defined as a piece of music with how many beats to the measure (bar)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: What is the standard I, IV, V chord progression in the key of E?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: E, A, B

questions.question: What is the acceptable chord progression for the beginner guitar classic House of the Rising Sun?

options.text: Am, C, D, F, Am, E, Am
F,G, R, Q, L, V, N
F, G, F, C, D, Am, D
C, G, D, A, Dm, G, C, G

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Am, C, D, F, Am, E, Am

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, carter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Guess singer who performs this classic rock song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don McLean

questions.question: What type of wine did Deana Carter sing about in 1996?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strawberry

questions.question: This is traditionally played at the end of a twelve bar blues pattern to separate verses and add some pizazz.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The turn around

questions.question: Which song do the following lyrics come from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drinkin Dark Whiskey

questions.question: Name the psychedelic/heavy metal band who performs the song on the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Oyster Cult

questions.question: Which band or singer performs this song that contains a reference to the Watergate scandal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beastie Boys

questions.question: Guess the band or the singer performing the song on the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bangles

questions.question: Who originally recorded the song Red Red Wine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Diamond

questions.question: What band recorded the song Beer Drinkers and Hell Raisers in 1973?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ZZ Top

questions.question: Guess the band or the singer performing this 1999 single.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Foo Fighters

questions.question: According to the lyrics and title of a George Thorogood song, he would have one bourbon, one scotch and what else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One beer

questions.question: In what year did Garth Brooks release the song Two Pina Coladas, which hit #1 on the Billboard Country Charts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1998

questions.question: Who sang the following lyrics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Foreigner

questions.question: What country group released the song Cool Drink of Water in 1991?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooks and Dunn

questions.question: Which band recorded this Grammy Award-winning song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Smashing Pumpkins

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Billy Idol and Drummer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, award-winning, punk. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the birth name of pop/rock artist Billy Idol, who achieved massive success in the 1980s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Micheal Albert Broad

questions.question: This album, released in 2005 by Billy Idol, includes the songs Super Overdrive and Evil Eye .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Devils Playground

questions.question: Billy Idol played in the movie The Doors, directed by Oliver Stone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This 1990 film, directed by Renny Harlin, features Billy Idols song Cradle of Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ford Fairlane

questions.question: Which band released this song on their album Blood Sugar Sex Magik?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Hot Chili Peppers

questions.question: Billy Idol played himself in the romantic comedy, The Wedding Singer, starring Adam Sandler and this actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drew Barrymore

questions.question: Who performed this song included in the album Kill Em All?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metallica

questions.question: Which band performed this Grammy Award-winning song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soundgarden

questions.question: Billy Idol was born in Middlesex, England on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: November 30th, 1955

questions.question: He is often cited as the ideal rock drummer. He first became famous as the drummer for Led  Zeppelin. He later played with Band of Joy and Terry Web and the Spiders. Who is this drummer known as Bonzo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Bonham

questions.question: He was the drummer for Nirvana. When Cobain died, he  formed The Foo Fighters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Grohl

questions.question: Is it true that Billy Idol once dropped his spiky peroxide hairstyle in place of dreadlocks, and experimented with techno beats?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Has Billy Idol ever been featured on the VH-1 series, Behind The Music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What punk rock band was formed in 1976 by Billy Idol, Tony James and Terry Chimes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Generation X

questions.question: Billy Idols first stint as a guitar player was with which punk band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chelsea

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Drummer and Work
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, booker. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was the drummer for The Allman Brothers Band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jai Johanny Johanson

questions.question: This sensational drummer is often called the hit maker for his work as a sessions drummer. He  claims that he over-dubbed the drums on all the early Beatles albums. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bernie  Purdie

questions.question: He is most famous as Jimi Hendrix drummer. He has also worked for Carlos Santana, Wilson Pickett, The Delfonics, Ruby and the Romantics, and many other famous rock groups.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddy Miles

questions.question: He is perhaps best known for his work on Deep Purples Fire Ball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ian Paice

questions.question: He was the drummer for Rush.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neal Peart

questions.question: In 1962 he became the drummer for The Rolling Stones.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Watts

questions.question: He was born in Philadelphia in 1965. His most famous group used his nickname as the name of the  group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jon Fishman

questions.question: He was the drummer on Green Onions with Booker T and the MGs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Jackson

questions.question: Everyone who tries to be a rock drummer attempts to learn Wipe Out by the Surfaris. Who was their  drummer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Wilson

questions.question: This drummer first became prominent as the drummer for Frank Zappa. He later became famous for his work with Jeff Beck and Korn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Bozzio

questions.question: This musician was the drummer on most of the hits by Cactus and Vanilla Fudge.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carmine Appice

questions.question: He was the drummer for The Eagles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Henley

questions.question: Jack Bruce played bass, Eric Clapton played lead  guitar, and this man played drums in the group Cream.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginger Baker

questions.question: While many people dont know his name, most people know the albums of Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young. This drummer helped make this groups albums so great.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas Taylor

questions.question: He was the drummer for Bruce Springsteen and for the E-Street Band. He also has been the leader of  Conan OBriens band on The Late  Show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Max  Weinberg

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Pink Floyd and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocals, pink. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first Pink Floyd album, The Piper at the Gates of Dawn, premiered in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1967

questions.question: This 1973 album by Pink Floyd spent 741 weeks on the Billboard Top 200.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dark Side of the Moon

questions.question: Who performed the vocals on Pink Floyds song Have a Cigar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roy Harper

questions.question: You Can Call Me Al was a hit song for this singer in the 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Simon

questions.question: The song Mickey was a big hit song for this singer in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toni Basil

questions.question: Which of these tracks from Pink Floyds album Meddle contains a line spoken by Nick Mason?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One of These Days

questions.question: What was the birth name of Syd Barrett, the original front man of Pink Floyd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Keith Barrett

questions.question: The Beatles Hey Jude was a song written for John Lennons son Julian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This drummer joined The Red Hot Chili Peppers in 1988.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chad Smith

questions.question: Jimmy Mack was a big hit song for this female group in 1967.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martha and the Vandellas

questions.question: He is a fine drummer whose popular father played drums in a famous quartet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zach Starkey

questions.question: What was the first album, that Pink Floyd recorded with guitarist David Gilmour?

options.text: The Piper at the Gates of Dawn

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saucerful of Secrets

questions.question: In 1975, Syd Barrett appeared unexpectedly at Abbey Road Studios, while Pink Floyd were recording which album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wish You Were Here

questions.question: This drummer, famous as the only member who appeared on every Pink Floyd album, wrote the book Inside Out: A Personal History of Pink Floyd.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nick Mason

questions.question: Singer/Songwriter Jim Croce gave us this mammoth hit song in 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad Bad Leroy Brown
